Fields.DialogueText: Perth? Perth!
When looking westward, I beheld a something in the sky...
Perth!
Huh? Were you talking to me, Captain?
No, I was talking to another ship called Perth.
Don't tell me I need to work on my shouting skills.
No, it's just easy for a name like mine to be confused with something else. I thought you were talking about a bird perching on the ramparts, or perhaps something to the portside.
Really?
It's a simple mistake. So, anyway, what did you wish to tell me?

Fields.MenuText: I was checking if you were keeping an eye – and ear – out for things. I suppose I got my answer anyway.
Never mind. I forgot it while we were having this conversation.
I... just wanted to chat a little.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm staying alert, Captain. There's nothing to worry about.
You really shouldn't let yourself get distracted, Captain.
Oh, I'm sorry about that, Captain. I'll try to be more welcoming the next time.
I apologize, Captain.
It's all right. But I would have thought you would have noticed your name being called.
I know, but it's just... I'm still getting used to that name.
You are?
We can talk later. I spotted a Morgana force a little ways over there, and they don't look friendly.
@BATTLE
You're telling me?
*ALARM*
The enemy's almost in range, Captain.
Glad to hear it. Sometimes the waiting is the hardest part...
@BATTLE
Good job out there, Perth.
Oh? Why, thank you, Captain.
Now, then, you were saying about your name...?
It's not a big deal. It's just... I was only recently named Perth when the British navy sold me over to Australia. Before that, my name was Amphion.

Fields.MenuText: That's kind of tougher to say than Perth, though.
I thought Amphion was Greek.
Do you want me to call you Amphion?

Fields.DialogueText: That's only because you aren't used to it.
Oh, Captain, don't you have a respect for the classics?
Thanks, but no. Perth is my name now, so I had best get used to it.
Anyway, I should get back to work now.
Same here. See you later... Amph.
Amph?
Just a little nickname while you get used to your new name.
Very well, Captain.
Perth, are you busy?
Wha! Don't startle me like that!
Sorry, but I wanted to ask you something. Do you... hey, what's this?
It's... nothing, just a little piece of memorabilia I picked up somewhere.
A poster of the USS Houston?
Is that Houston? I didn't pay close attention.
With a poem of appreciation written in the bottom corner?
Well... um... the exact nature of poetry can be debatable. What one person sees as an observation of nature may to another...
That's not the only Houston memorabilia I'm seeing in this room.
Don't you have respect for a lady's privacy?
I wasn't the one who had it out where anyone could walk in and find it – which I did.
You're right...

Fields.MenuText: So you have a girl crush on Houston?
So why Houston?
Does Houston know?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not a girl crush! It's just deep admiration for her, and I think that, if we were ever to meet, we would be great friends.
Why not? She is so fearless and determined. I want to be just like her one day.
No! You can't tell her about all of this! Please!
You can have heroes if you want, Perth. I don't mind. And don't worry, I won't tell anyone else.
Thank you, Captain.
Now, you'd better stow that away somewhere. We're reaching the staging point for the attack.
@BATTLE
So... a girl crush.
... I guess.
Interesting...
What are you looking at?
A visitor's guide to Australia.
Oh, I see. You're reading the section on Perth?
Yes. I want to learn more about the city I am named after now.

Fields.MenuText: So you didn't gain additional memories of Australia when you... awoke?
Learned anything interesting?
The best way to learn is to visit and see it first hand.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think so. It's more like a vague understanding. It's rather embarrassing, so I want to fill in the gaps.
Yes, indeed. I never realized that Perth is in fact the sunniest capital in all the world. The perfect sort of weather for a merry song!
You're right. I'll have to see if the war takes us over there at some point, so I can ask for some furlough time.
Mind if I take a look, too?
Certainly, but why?
Well, I want to learn more about you, and what you wish to become.
Sure, no problem. I can give you a book on Portsmouth as well. But right now, we have a battle to deal with.
That sounds interesting. But you're right.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Of harmony in tones and numbers hit, by voice or hand, and various-measur'd...
You have a lovely voice.
Why, thank you, Captain. Though it would not be the same without the lyre to accompany my voice.
What was that from?
It's from Milton's odes to Paradise.
I wasn't aware the poem was a song.
Poetry first gained birth as a type of song, so it is only natural that it can flow back to its original form. Anyway, I appreciate the audience.
But, you know, you would probably get more listeners if you sang where people could hear you more easily. Don't you want to see the others?
They'd just mess up my singing. Especially some of those uncouth barbarians.

Fields.MenuText: Uncouth or not, I am certain that they love music in their own way.
Song is meant to be shared, though.
Even if you mess up, you can still have fun, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe...
That is correct. If a tree cries out in the woods and nobody is there to hear it, does it matter if she makes a sound or not?
You're right. It's best to just be merry and go with the flow.
I'll think about it. In any case, I was about to wrap up this song for now.
Why's that?
Another Morgana is closing in on us, what else?
I should have known...
@BATTLE
Perth, are you – what the – ?
Careful, Captain! You almost ruined my shot!
So sorry for getting in the way... what are you playing?
Shuffleboard, what else? It is a lot of fun.
Did you really have to commandeer the whole deck for it, though?
You need plenty of room for a good competition. Now, could you get out of the way, please? I need to figure out my next move.

Fields.MenuText: That's kind of rude, you know.
Mind if I play, too?
Perth, I need you to get back to work.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph. It's rude to disrupt fun, you know. But I suppose I can be a little kinder to people.
Sure. This will be great.
Fine... I suppose you're right, I need to stay alert.
You must love games like this, huh?
I enjoy any kind of game. Without fun in life, whether games or songs, things just become dull and meaningless.
In any case, you had best finish up your game. I don't like the game those Morganas wish to play.
Well, that just means we need to switch games. Time to see if I can improve my score of defeating those ships.
@BATTLE
Looking at that poster again? You must really like Houston.
I sure do! She's so brave, so bold.
Out of curiosity, though, have you actually talked to her?
What? No, I...wouldn't be able to get the words out.
So you're just going to stay silent about it, never move forward?
What else can I do? What if she doesn't want to be friends with me?

Fields.MenuText: You said you wanted to be fearless like her, right? Then you have to take a stand.
You won't know until you try.
Does that mean your admiration for her doesn't run quite as deep as you thought?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes... she would not be impressed with a coward such as I.
And sometimes it is best not to know.
I... don't know.
Well, I'm sorry that I pushed you about this. I'll see you later.
Wait. I am not yet ready to talk to Houston. But, perhaps, we can slowly prepare myself for that fateful step.
So what are you going to do?
Me? I said, "we."
Wait, what?
Since you already know my secret, I can practice with you, right?
Okay, I guess. We'll start after we take care of this battle.
@BATTLE
So... I'm helping you work up the courage to befriend Houston. Do you have a plan on how to approach this?
I'm... not sure. Might you have a suggestion?
First of all, how much do you know about her?
Everything! I've kept myself informed on all of her forays, her building history, her fan magazine...
What about things that aren't just hearsay?
What do you mean? I have put a lot of research into this.
Research is different than firsthand knowledge. You don't really know somebody until you're face to face.
That's what we're trying to get ready for right now.

Fields.MenuText: You're already sweating.
There's a lot of things I have only learned by talking to you. Houston is probably the same way.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm nervous!
You're right. A hero like her must keep her secrets close to her heart, to protect them from harm. So noble...
Just try to do small things with her, and see how things develop. In any case, you'll need to learn to work alongside her if we want to defeat the Morganas.
You're right. With demons everywhere, we cannot afford to stay divided.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Perth?
Shush! We're at the best part right now.
Oh, is that Bing Crosby?
Yes, now please be quiet. You'll drown out his song.
Sorry. Mind if I watch, too?
Sure. Oh, Bing...

Fields.MenuText: I thought Houston was your true love?
Have you tried singing some of his songs yourself?
You seem to really like Crosby, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: What? Can't a girl have multiple platonic crushes?
I have, but I am still working out how to convert them to a lyre-based performance.
Yep! His songs are just so moving, don't you think so?
Well, that was a great movie. I'm guessing you didn't arrange for fireworks, though.
... No. It looks as if we have bigger problems on our hands.
Time to sink more ships.
Don't worry. We're the stars of this drama, so as long as we don't give up, we can't lose.
@BATTLE
Yes! Just keep from moving your foot right onto mine when you're getting all excited!
Let's see... From the mighty East you carried him, over wave and rough to Oregon.
No, no, that's not it.
What are you working on?
A letter that I am going to send to Houston.
Oh? Great! How's it coming along?
Not that well. For once, my tongue is all tied up.
Maybe I can help?
You can? Oh, thank you! I'm stumped at this point.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe write down your thoughts first, and then convert it to a lyrical form from there?
You should take a break and relax. Clear your head a little.
Take a deep breath, and just let your emotions flow out into words.

Fields.DialogueText: That could work. I'll see what I can do.
That's a good idea. Some fun in the sun always helps cheer me up.
Right. Here I go.
Thank you for your help, Captain. It means a lot to me.
No problem. I hope it works out for you.
Don't worry. Maybe it's just that I don't have practice doing poems for specific people. Mind if I do one for you for practice?
Knock yourself out – or not, at least until that Morgana is out of the way.
@BATTLE
Going for a swim?
Yes. I just love getting in the water!
Well, in a way, you already are.
Very funny. But I want to try something different this time.
Is that a surfboard?
Exactly. It is apparently quite the rage in Australia, so I thought I might as well try it out.

Fields.MenuText: Just be careful not to get hurt.
Well, have fun. Do your best.
It's good to see that you're trying new things.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. A little jostle is hardly enough to capsize me.
I will. Maybe you can try it out too, later?
I'm just doing this because it is my duty. It's not like I see these silly customs as meaning anything!
Look there! A big wave is coming.
Yes, but not the kind you want. Battle stations, everybody!
Got it! Time to ride this wave to victory.
@BATTLE
Maybe.
Right...
Come on...
What's wrong?
My lyre was broken during the last battle.
I'm sorry to hear it. Can it be fixed?
Maybe, I don't know.

Fields.MenuText: You could buy a new lyre.
You can improvise with something else for the moment.
Don't worry. I'm sure things will work out in the end.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, but this one is special to me.
You're right. Before the lyre, one made do with what materials they had. Still, I miss playing mine.
Thanks. I hope they do.
How about I help you fix it?
Really? Thank you.
Besides, until I get it fixed, you still have your voice, right?
That's right! It won't be the same with the tempo of my lyre, but it's still something. Somewhere, beyond the... uh, oh.
Huh? Did you miss a beat?
No, but I missed a Morgana approaching. Here it comes!
@BATTLE
I understand.
Hey, Amph.
Good day to you, too.
Everyone else is having a party on the main deck to celebrate. You want to check it out?
No, thanks.
Why not? I thought you liked to have fun.
Yes, but others' ideas of fun can be quite different than mine. I just cannot stand a number of those uncivilized, wrongheaded foreigners. Best to just enjoy myself in privacy.
You would rather be all alone?
Well, no... but better that than a lot of people I don't understand.

Fields.MenuText: They won't learn about your version of fun unless you show them yourself.
Houston would probably like this sort of party.
Please, for me?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose you are right. I might as well grace them with my presence. I can at least bring a semblance of gentility to the festivities.
You think so? Then what are we waiting for? Let's go!
Oh, all right. I'll check it out, just for a little bit.
Don't worry, I'm sure this will be fun for both of us.
If you say so. Well, at least you'll be there with me.
Of course. We're friends, right?
Yes... we are.
So... how is my lyre coming along?
I'm working on it. I should have everything fixed up soon.
Thank you!
That said, I'm not the owner, so you'll probably want to tweak the instrument a little. But I did my best, in any case.
That's all I can hope for. But, there was one thing I wanted to ask...
What's that?
There was a distinctive marking on the base. It resembled a crescent next to a star. Is it still there?
I see what you're talking about. I'm sorry, but the water got at it during the spill. I can still make it out, though... sort of.
I suppose it was just a futile wish that it was still there.
If you show me a better image, I could try to make another mark...
No, I might as well let it go. Doesn't matter now.
What was it?
It was the emblem of noble Portsmouth, the proud soldier of the sea. Look, just make a replacement with a symbol for Perth.

Fields.MenuText: There's no reason you can't have both, is there?
Sorry, not in my skill set. You'll have to do it yourself when I'm finished with the rest of the repairs.
Are you really sure that you want to do this?

Fields.DialogueText: I... don't know if that is possible. Can a soldier serve two nations?
Me? I... this is like being the one to bell the cat.
No, but do I have a choice, really?
On second thought, add the new emblem further up the base. And try to spruce up the old one, got it?
Sure thing, Amph.
Amph...  for now, at least, I will hold onto my cherished memories of my former homeland.
Looks like I'll have to finish your lyre later. We have Morganas incoming!
Dear Portsmouth, my motherland... give me strength to defend the seas.
@BATTLE
Well, we're out here together, aren't we?
We always have choices, one way or another.
Amph? Did you hear that yelling? I swear somebody was shouting "YEE-HAW" at the top of their lungs.
Howdy there, sailor! YEE-HAW! YEEEEEE-HAW!
Oh. There's my answer, I suppose.
Didn't it sound just like Miss Houston was aboard the ship?
Not quite. I recognized the, uh, lyrical inflection in your voice.
Really? Too bad. I thought that I had it just right.
Well, maybe somebody else would have trouble telling the difference. What's all this about?
I want Houston to respect me as a sailor in my own right, so I thought this would give me an idea of how to be like her more.

Fields.MenuText: If you want Houston to like you, she should like you for the qualities you already have.
You will never be Houston. Nor will Houston ever be you. And both of you are the better for that.
True bravery comes from within.

Fields.DialogueText: Like what?
I... guess you are right.
Good point. I'll prove to Houston that I can be courageous on the battlefield, in my own way!
I have to say, though, I'm impressed with how hard you were yelling "YEE-HAW!"
Thank you, though I still can't get it exactly right. Just how does she do it?
I'll ask that you stop practicing for now. We have a battle coming up, and I don't want any confusion on the battlefield.
@BATTLE
Your singing, your playful optimism... they are all equally important.
*ALARM*
Perth...
Zzzz... what? I'm trying to build up a tan.
In the middle of the deck? You're kind of in the way.
Can't be helped. This is the best spot to soak in the sun right now.
Can't you go somewhere else? Please?
Tell you what – when the shade shifts in a couple hours, I'll move out of the way. How's that?

Fields.MenuText: Perth, I order you to move.
Want to play a game?
Don't you need to keep watch?

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, fine.
That sounds great! What do you want to play?
I can still manage things in my sleep. Why, I have driven off a dozen sky Morganas so far.
Look, I have nothing against you sunbathing, but you need to do so in a way that does not disrupt anyone else.
I know, but where else can I go? Unless...
Unless what?
Just something for later. Come on! I think we have a sea Morgana approaching.
@BATTLE
Considering that it's clear skies and no Morganas, I think your idea doesn't hold water.
Where is it? Where is it?
What's wrong?
Captain! I lost a small pin of mine. Do you happen to see it anywhere?
Is it for the 1939 World's Fair? If so, I got it.
Thank you! I was so worried that I lost it forever.
You're welcome. Why's it so important to you?
I just... I remember that Fair so clearly for some reason. And I want to hang on to those memories.

Fields.MenuText: What was your favorite attraction there?
Those peaceful days seem miles away now, huh?
Did anything big happen while you were there?

Fields.DialogueText: Ralph Williams' Five Variants. That was a concert for the ages.
Well, there were already tensions, then. Still, I want to hang onto memories of a more hopeful time, so we know what we are fighting to protect.
One thing – the crew nearly mutinied while we were there. They were old sailors like me, and didn't like the switch. But we compromised, and things worked out.
I wonder where the next World's Fair is going to be...
Who knows? Someplace civilized, I hope. But never mind that now. We have work to do.
You're right. If we don't stop the Morganas, there might be nothing left to celebrate.
@BATTLE
I see.
That is why I still hang onto the pin. With it, perhaps I can be both Amphion and Perth.
Zzz...
Perth, are you up here? Woah!
Oh, sorry about that, Captain. I guess I rolled in my sleep.
You nearly knocked me off the ladder. What are you doing?
Sunbathing. Up, off the deck, out of the way. I thought you would be pleased.
I'm just a little surprised that you chose the roof, of all places.
Yes, here I can relax in peace.

Fields.MenuText: Just be careful not to fall.
Isn't the metal plating hot?
Just make sure you don't fall too asleep. You never know when more trouble will come our way.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be fine. Just be careful yourself - it's dangerous up here.
For a human, maybe, but it just helps enhance the ambience for me.
Not to worry. If anything attacks, I'll make it regret disturbing my beauty sleep.
Okay, this place can be our little secret - a getaway for the both of us.
Thanks!
I have to admit, it is rather quiet up here.
I know, right? It's the perfect place to be away from all of the hubbub.
Not for long. Take a look over there.
Oh. At least we spotted it sooner this time. Careful getting down to the main level. We'll need your guidance to win.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All right, Amph. Your lyre is finally fixed.
Thank you! Now I can play my songs again.
No problem. Out of curiosity, why the lyre?
Whatever do you mean?
I mean, out of all the instruments, what makes the lyre stand out to you?
Well, given my name, I thought it was only natural to play like the Grecian shepherds of old. It made more sense when I was called Amphion.
I'm sorry – I didn't mean it like that. I think your lyre is great!
Yes, but it is hardly typical for "Down Under," isn't it? Maybe I should switch out to something more modern.

Fields.MenuText: On the contrary, I think you chose just the right instrument. There is something called a lyrebird in Australia, didn't you know?
Actually, I like how you are finding ways to adapt your lyre to contemporary music. The resulting symphony is very inspiring, and what we need right now.
Don't be ashamed of who you are and where you came from. Take pride in being unique.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? The fates move in strange ways, I suppose.
Thanks. That means a lot to me.
You're right. I have a proud legacy from all across the globe in my blood, and that history still lives within me.
As thanks for saving my lyre, may I play you a song?
Certainly. But let's wait until we deal with these Morganas, so you won't get drowned out.
@BATTLE
Captain! Did you see that island over there?
Why, yes. What about it?
It looks empty, and mysterious. Want to take a closer look?
I'm not sure we need to stop. We're pretty well-stocked at the moment.
That's not the point. Think of the adventure! We might even find buried treasure.
Treasure? Really?
Come on! Please?

Fields.MenuText: The odds of finding anything, much less treasure, are low.
You'll only be able to explore the shoreline, you know?
Just as long as it doesn't take too long.

Fields.DialogueText: It's the adventure and exploration that's important more than the actual treasure.
I know, but it's still something. Besides, I can actually enjoy some genuine beachcombing for a change.
Don't worry. I won't dawdle.
Okay, we can take a break here. Or, on second thought...
What?
Let's stop here for a beach party – after we sink those few Morganas.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain on the bridge!
Glad you could make it, Captain.
Wouldn't miss it for the world.
@BATTLE
Amph! Are you okay there?
I'm fine! Whew, this fight's getting intense. No telling who will break first.
Well, we can't afford to slip up. The convoy is depending on us to hold the line. Think you can do that?
Of course! Though, I wonder what Houston would do right now...
Right now, that kind of wondering doesn't matter. What's important is what we do.
You're right. Any new orders, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Try to coordinate your attacks with the crew. I know that you have trouble with some of them, but we need to work as a team.
Push the Morganas back.
Hold your ground – or water, I suppose.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Best to avoid the fate that Thebes faced after Oedipus. I'll put aside my differences.
I'm on it! Watch me, Houston, I'm not holding back.
Tough analogy for a ship, I admit. But I get the gist. Don't worry – they won't get past me!
Keep up the good work. We'll get through this yet.
Thanks, Captain. Having you here makes me feel brave like Houston.
Just don't get too cocky. We still have a ways to go.
Just means we have to work harder. The dawn is coming, Captain, and soon these phantoms will be nothing but shadows against our courage.
@BATTLE
Captain, are you –?
Amph, watch out!
Whoa! You nearly hit me with that wooden banana!
Sorry. I wanted to give this to you.
What is it? Some kind of spade?
No, it's a boomerang. You throw it the right way, and it comes back to you.
Huh. Kind of interesting.
Anyway, it's from Australia, so I thought you might like to try it out.
Australia? Wait... is this that strange tool those Aboriginal people use?
Um... I think they invented it, yes. Why do you ask?
Well, thank you for the offer, but... I am more interested in learning about the... sophisticated elements of my new home. The ones that matter.

Fields.MenuText: You need to open up to people – all kinds of people – if you want to understand them.
Sorry. I just thought that you would like it.
Everything matters in one way or another. Who knows – these "uncivilized" things might save your life one day.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll... see what I can do.
I do! It's just... I don't know.
I think you're exaggerating. What are the odds that this thingamajig will be vital to our survival?
Well, since it's a gift from you, I suppose that I cannot refuse. Thank you.
You're welcome. Let me know if you... figure out how to use it.
Sure. But right now, we have a job to take care of.
Right. Just make sure you put the boomerang somewhere safe, you hear? We don't want it to get broken in the fray.
Okay, okay. It is kind of nice, I guess. I'll make sure it is not harmed.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
(whispers) Hey, Captain?
What is it, Perth?
Shhh! Quiet! Why do you think I was whispering?
Oh, okay. Does this have to do with your plans for Houston?
Yes. Now can we please get somewhere private?
Let's head to the roof. We should have things to ourselves there.
... a few minutes later...
Okay. Now, then, I wrote a sample letter for you. So let me know what you think.
All right, let's take a look...
So...
This is...
Come on, I want an answer. Is the poem good?

Fields.MenuText: It's... beautiful.
I almost want to sing it aloud.
You're really something, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Great! I did my best with it.
Perfect. That is exactly what I was hoping for.
... Thank you.
This letter is a masterpiece. So emotional, so wonderful...
I'm glad you like it. Now I just have to modify it for Houston.
What? Oh, right...
Thank you for all your help with this. You're the best!
You're welcome. Anyway... good luck. I'm sure Houston will think it's lovely.
She will, but for now I have revising to do. And Morganas to sink.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Amph, where are you?! We have Morganas headed this way!
Hold on, I'm just setting up my lyre to play.
Play, now?! We'll be engaging them in a matter of seconds!
All the better time to make music, then. A little melody helps set the mood for a fight.
This isn't a good idea.
Please?

Fields.MenuText: What if your lyre gets damaged again?
I think the gunshots will block out the music.
Are you sure you can sing and fight?

Fields.DialogueText: Both of us know what's at stake here. We have to live with the risk.
Then we'll just have to put our hearts into it. In this dark time, we need to make sure that our song brings hope, no matter if we fall along the way.
In the olden days, warriors were also artists. I feel that it is time to revive that tradition.
Look, I have to do this. I can't just let it slide. This is my way of standing up to the Morganas.
In that case, could you use a singing partner?
Sure. Here's a page with the lyrics. Ready?
Okay! Um... From this day to the ending of the world...
But we in it shall be remembered!
@BATTLE
Thank you for coming up here. I know it's tougher for you to get up to the roof than it is for me.
Don't worry. So, what did you want to talk about?
Well, I've decided. As soon as we're done up here, I am going to speak with Houston, and...
...And?
Talk to her.
You're ready for that?
As ready as I will be, I think. But first, I wish to thank you, Captain.
Me?
Yes. You gave me the courage to take action, and the perspective to see from different views than my own. Without you, I don't know where I would be.
Amph...
Well, I had best get on with it. Wish me luck!
Wait!
What is it?

Fields.MenuText: Best wishes to you. I'm rooting for you.
You're a very special girl, Perth.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Captain. You're such a dear friend to me.
Aww... I think you're pretty special too, Captain.
